data.prayer: Spirit, guide every search on Google for truth in Aegean, Greece to find a gospel video.
data.verse: you will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Aegean, Greece
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, please send new apostles into the harvest, who can open up new communities for the gospel in the state of Aegean, Greece.
data.verse: Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 302,700 souls living in the state of Aegean with a taste for your Word. Make it sweet as honey in their mouth.
data.verse: How sweet are your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

data.prayer: Father, we pray that the state of Aegean be filled with simple churches in every neighborhood.
data.verse: For the earth will be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.

data.prayer: Jesus, I pray that all the Persian people will remember and turn to you, Lord God. May all the Persian people worship before you. For the kingdom of the Persian people is yours.
Lord we pray you unite the 1,509 believers to pray at all times in the Spirit, with all prayer and supplication, for spiritual breakthrough in Aegean.
data.verse: in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Aegean to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.prayer: Jesus, please find the broken hearted among the 302,700 souls in Aegean and mend their wounds.
data.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

location.name: Aegean
location.people_groups_list: South Asian, general, Arab, Egyptian, Arab, Saidi, Japanese, Jew, Greek-speaking
